hand.title: Real-time Hand Detection and Finger Counting
hand.description: This project involves developing a complete application for hand detection, skeleton recognition (landmarks), and automatic counting of raised fingers in real-time using a webcam. The application relies on the combined use of two powerful libraries: MediaPipe and OpenCV.
hand.obj_1: Automatically detect one or more hands in a video stream.
hand.obj_2: Extract the exact position of the 21 key points ("landmarks") of the hand.
hand.obj_3: Determine which fingers are raised using precise geometric analysis.
hand.obj_4: Dynamically display skeletons, number of raised fingers, and distance between points (e.g., thumb-index).
hand.step_1_text: Configuration of the HandDetector class with MediaPipe Hands. Adjustable parameters: static/dynamic mode, max hands, and confidence thresholds for robust detection.
hand.step_2_text: The find_hands() method analyzes the image and draws the skeleton. find_position() extracts the (x, y) coordinates of the 21 key points for each hand, essential for spatial analysis.
hand.step_3_text: The fingers_up() method compares finger tip positions relative to joints to determine if they are raised or lowered (specific logic for the thumb).
hand.step_4_text: Dynamic calculation of distance between two points (e.g., thumb-index pinch) with find_distance(), opening the way for advanced gesture controls (zoom, validation).
hand.interface_text: Thanks to OpenCV, the application offers a smooth experience with immediate visual feedback:
hand.conclusion_text: This project demonstrates solid mastery of real-time image processing and AI applied to computer vision. It provides a robust, high-performance, and modular foundation for future interactive developments.

flipper.title: Simple Pinball – Unity WebGL Game
flipper.description: This project consists of creating and publishing a pinball game developed with Unity and made accessible directly from a browser via WebGL export. The main goal was to offer a simple, smooth, and universal gaming experience without requiring any installation.
flipper.obj_1: Design a complete and functional game with Unity.
flipper.obj_2: Export the game to WebGL for optimal web compatibility.
flipper.obj_3: Integrate this WebGL build into a custom HTML page.
flipper.obj_5: Offer a clean interface focused on the gaming experience.
flipper.concept_text: The game is a simplified version of pinball where the player controls two flippers to keep the ball in play. Physics is entirely managed by the Unity engine.
flipper.webgl_text: Integration allows loading the Unity engine directly in the browser via WebAssembly (WASM), offering near-native performance.
flipper.visual_text: The interface is designed to be simple and immersive: a game zone centered on a clean page, distraction-free. This minimalist approach reinforces readability and optimizes application performance, allowing the player to focus solely on the score.
flipper.tech_unity_text: Gameplay creation, physics, scene management, and export.
flipper.tech_webgl_text: High-performance web rendering technology via WebAssembly.
flipper.tech_web_text: Communication between Unity and DOM, responsive management, and deployment.
flipper.conclusion_text: Simple Pinball is a project combining creativity and modern technical skills. Instantly playable from any browser, this pinball demonstrates effective use of Unity and web deployment, proving the ability to deliver smooth interactive experiences on the web.

lecri.title: The Scream – Interactive WebGL Experience
lecri.description: This project consists of creating a complete and interactive 3D scene using WebGL via Three.js, integrated into a web page designed to highlight an iconic work: The Scream by Edvard Munch. The goal was to transform an iconic painting into an immersive digital experience.
lecri.obj_1: Recreate a 3D atmosphere inspired by The Scream painting, respecting its visual mood.
lecri.obj_2: Design an aesthetic, fluid, and optimized WebGL scene for the browser.
lecri.obj_3: Integrate various 3D models, textures, and advanced graphic effects.
lecri.obj_4: Allow user interaction with the scene via camera controls and a GUI interface.
lecri.obj_5: Illustrate understanding of Three.js, GLTF, OBJ, lighting, and post-processing technologies.
lecri.concept_text_1: The user discovers a vast and atmospheric scene composed of an animated aquatic environment, 3D bridges recalling the original painting's walkways, moving boats, and a 3D model of The Scream character, illuminated like a museum piece.
lecri.concept_text_2: An immersive skybox wraps the entire scene in an artistic sky, accompanied by visual effects such as fog, ground reflections, specular textures, and realistic shadows.
lecri.feat_1_text: The environment is designed to envelop the viewer in an ambiance recalling the painting's expressiveness. The skybox and textures reinforce this immersion.
lecri.feat_2_text: Multiple light sources coexist: a directional sun for dramatic shadows, soft ambient light, and a spotlight focused on the model.
lecri.feat_3_text: Progressive fog for depth, transparent materials for water, and mirror effects for an elegant artistic render.
lecri.feat_4_text: A large expanse of water crafted with repeated texture, specular map, adjustable shininess, and controlled transparency.
lecri.feat_5_text: 3D objects (boats) moving on real-time calculated trajectories, demonstrating stable JS animation management.
lecri.feat_6_text: dat.GUI interface allowing real-time modification of zoom, fog, lights, and water properties.
lecri.conclusion_text: This WebGL project around Edvard Munch's "The Scream" is a complete demonstration of artistic and technical integration. It combines 3D modeling, programming, web aesthetics, advanced visual effects, and user interaction to create a unique immersive experience.
